results.title: Str8 outta Melbourne
results.brief_description:
Iconic images of Melbourne city flash on and off the screen to the beat of the boys from the burbs, rap performers, Jesse Galofaro and Somchay Phakonkham.
Contains two versions: 00:14-03:51 - unedited and uses coarse language 03:58-07:40 - edited (no coarse language)

results.title: Stowaway. Part 3. Food storage
results.brief_description: Covers the inspection of food by the U.S. Army Veterinary Corps, the Bureau of Animal Industry and the Port Food Service Inspector prior to procurement for use aboard troop transports. Shows in detail the principles and proper facilities for food storage and preservation.

results.title: Stourhead
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place in the Country”
Stourhead is the home of the Hoare banking family. The building is classified by the National Trust and this film examines its history.

results.title: Storyboard
results.brief_description:
Storyboards help filmmaking teams visualise a film and how to tell the film’s story through images. In a film, the audience follows a story not just through character’s dialogue, but also through their actions. Even objects and settings help tell a story.

You can make decisions about how things will look by creating a storyboard. Each panel in a storyboard represents a camera shot and therefore what the camera will see and show. You do not have to recreate every frame of a film in a storyboard; that would take forever!
results.description:

results.title: Story structures: finding the hook
results.creator_credit: John A. Givins, Lynn John and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Video tech”.
Focuses on video storytelling through the analysis of story structure, telling the story, finding the hook to keep people interested, and visualising the story. It explores the six basic questions which must be answered in a story: Who? What? When? Where? Why? and How?
